meanings.definition: A person of the same age, status, or ability as another.
meanings.sent1: My peers in class are my friends who are the same age as me.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys playing games with her peers during recess.
meanings.sent3: At the party, my peers and I all wore silly hats for fun.
meanings.sent4: In the competition, he stood out among his peers like a shining star.
meanings.sent5: During the field trip, my peers and I explored the forest together.

meanings.definition: To look keenly or with difficulty at someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She peers through the window to see if her friend has arrived.
meanings.sent2: The detective peers closely at the evidence to solve the case.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat peers at the fish swimming in the bowl.
meanings.sent4: The hiker peers into the distance, trying to spot the mountain peak.
meanings.sent5: The scientist peers into the microscope to observe tiny cells.
